subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – a figure with two lines {{zh-l|*二}} for a head (one connected to body, one above it), emphasizing the head.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
Possibly related to {{och-l|原}} "source, origin, basic, primary" and {{och-l|黿}} "large turtle" (whose {{w|back-formation}} might be {{och-l|鰲}} "mythological turtle" with final ''-n'' discarded due to folk etymology) ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}), and also {{och-l|高}}.

Compare {{cog|tbq-pro|*m~s-gaw||head}}. If so, cognate with {{och-l|后}} "ruler, lord (''obsolete''), queen"; {{cog|bo|མགོ||head, summit, beginning}} (⇒ {{m|bo|མགོ.དཔོན||headman}}), {{cog|grt|sko ||skull}}, {{cog|tji|kho⁵⁵ pa⁵⁵||head}} (STEDT, {{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).  
*{{zh-ref|Thurgood (1985)}} cites Mei Tsu-lin's opinion that 元 and {{och-l|君}} are variants of each other and cognates with {{cog|bo|མགོན||protector; master; lord}}.
